item.title: PGA Tour 2K25 Courses Revealed: All 29 Courses Coming To The Game
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/pga-tour-2k25-courses-revealed-all-29-courses/

2K Sports has revealed 26 of the 29 courses launching with PGA Tour 2K25 when it releases on February 28. This year’s game features 29 license courses at release with more to be added—The Old Course at St. Andrews being one of them—via post-launch updates.

Courses making their franchise debut include Oakmont Country Club and Royal Portrush Golf Club.

Making their debut in the PGA Tour 2K series are three major tournaments: The U.S Open, PGA Championship, and The Open Championship. The Masters currently remains exclusive to EA Sports PGA Tour. The tournaments will be a part of the game’s MyCareer along with events such as the Arnold Palmer Invitational, Tour Championship, AT&T Pebble Beach Pro-Am, and more.

If you don’t see a course you were hoping to play, there’s the possibility that it could come later on. There’s also the ability to create it yourself or download someone else’s design via the game’s course creator.

PGA Tour 2K25 Courses

  • Atlantic Beach Country Club
  • The Bay Hill Club & Lodge
  • Copperhead Course
  • Detroit Golf Club
  • East Lake Golf Club
  • Oakmont Country Club (the 2025 U.S. Open)
  • Payne’s Valley
  • Pebble Beach
  • Pinehurst Resort & Country Club
  • Quail Hollow (the 2025 PGA Championship)
  • The Riviera Country Club
  • Royal Portrush Golf Club
  • Spyglass Hill
  • St. George’s Golf & Country Club
  • TPC Boston
  • TPC Deere Run
  • TPC Louisiana
  • TPC River Highlands
  • TPC San Antonio
  • TPC Sawgrass (the 2025 Open Championship)
  • TPC Scottsdale
  • TPC Southwind
  • TPC Summerlin
  • TPC Twin Cities
  • Top of the Rock
  • Torrey Pines

What do you think of the courses launching with PGA Tour 2K25 on February 28? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, check out the first look at Conan the Barbarian and T-1000 Terminator in Mortal Kombat 1. And don’t forget to sign up for our newsletter.

item.title: Mortal Kombat 1 Gets First Look At Conan The Barbarian and T-1000 Terminator
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/mortal-kombat-1-first-look-at-conan-the-barbarian-and-t-1000-terminator/

The first in-game look of Conan the Barbarian and T-1000 Terminator has been unofficially revealed for Mortal Kombat 1. The first look comes via a Mortal Kombat 1 Pro Kompetition trailer.

In the first look, we see T-1000’s hand go from liquid metal to human. The character is based on actor Robert Patrick’s likeness from the movie. For Conan the Barbarian, it’s based on the likeness of Arnold Schwarzenegger from the 1982 movie. His appearance showcases a brutality where he puts a dagger through his opponent’s face before cutting him in half.

Conan the Barbarian won’t feature Schwarzenegger’s voice. However, Patrick is voicing his character in the game. You can check out the trailer for yourself below with the new character appearances starting around the 45 second mark.

Conan the Barbarian is scheduled to release for players on January 21. There is no release date yet for T-1000 Terminator. They are the last of the announced DLC fighters coming to the Mortal Kombat 1 roster. Current reports suggest that Warner Bros. Games and NetherRealm Studios scrapped plans for Kombat Pack 3 after a lackluster performance of the Khaos Reigns expansion.

Neither Warner Bros. Games nor NetherRealm Studios have confirmed this to be the case or responded to requests for comment on the reports. That said, should it be the end of future releases for the game, Mortal Kombat is expected to be a focus for Warner Bros. Games moving forward, according to its CEO.

What do you think of the first look at Conan the Barbarian and T-1000 Terminator in Mortal Kombat 1? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, check out the 11 games coming to the PlayStation Plus Game Catalog starting January 21. And don’t forget to sign up for our newsletter.

item.title: PGA Tour 2K25 Release Date & Platforms
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/pga-tour-2k25-release-date-platforms/

PGA Tour 2K25’s release date carries on the series’ pattern of two-year cycles. A new installment of expert ball-striking and green-reading beckons, and your tee time is arriving sooner than expected. We have news on 2K25’s launch and its day-one platforms.

Many golfers out there struggle with the round-to-round grind of the real thing. I fall into this category, and while I’m not the worst golfer, only the wish from a genie’s lamp could get me close to being good. 2K’s simulated golf series is the perfect playground for disillusioned players (like me) to capture a sliver of what it’s like to be great at golf.

PGA Tour 2K25 looks to be a natural evolution of everything we’ve seen before, and its release date and platforms are known.

When is PGA Tour 2K25’s Release Date?

PGA Tour 2K25 releases worldwide on February 28, but you can play the game earlier on January 21 through Early Access.

The “Next Round, Best Round” announcement trailer dropped on January 14. It highlighted visual upgrades over its predecessor, the introduction of three of the four majors (The Masters being exclusive to EA), some of its stacked roster, and the anticipated release date.

Clean your clubs, mark your balls, and prep your outfit because the round gets underway soon. Even though PGA Tour 2K25 has officially been announced, we’ve known about a new PGA Tour game since November. Take-Two let the news slip during a November 6 Earning’s Call.

PGA Tour 2K25 Release Time

A worldwide midnight launch for PGA Tour 2K25 is expected.

It’s standard practice for pretty much most titles nowadays, but expect a mightnight release in each region. This does mean it varies—depending on where you live—but Early Access also has a big say on how soon you get to experience PGA Tour 2K25 anyway.

All PGA Tour 2K25 Platforms

2K has confirmed the PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC as the only launch platforms at launch.

This means PGA Tour 2K23 is the last of its kind to incorporate all generations of consoles. A PS4 and Xbox One launch was also included, but the same can’t be said for PGA Tour 2K25. The developer and publisher have decided to move on, so if you’re looking to tee up 2K25, you need to have the right launch hardware.

As a golf enthusiast, I’m very excited to see the improvements 2K has made for PGA Tour 2K25. With rival franchise EA Sports PGA Tour now competing in the simulated golf space, it’s an exciting time. Which features are you eager for 2K to add? Does anything from 2K23 fundamentally need changing or improving?

2025 is set to be a big year for gaming. So check out what Xbox exclusives are coming to other platforms this year, as well as the 8 biggest PlayStation games arriving in 2025.

item.title: PlayStation Plus Game Catalog Gets 11 New Games In January
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/playstation-plus-game-catalog-gets-new-games-in-january/

Sony is kicking off 2025 in a big way, announcing that the PlayStation Plus Game Catalog will get 11 new games in January 2025. All of the games will be available for subscribers starting January 21.

Of the 11 games, nine of them will be available for both PlayStation Plus Extra and Premium members. The remaining two games are exclusively for those on the higher-priced Premium subscription.

RELATED: PlayStation Plus Monthly Games for January 2025 Revealed

Looking at the list of games coming to the game catalog, some of the more prominent titles include God of War Ragnarök and Like a Dragon Gaiden: The Man Who Erased His Name. All of the additions this month are new to the library.

It’s not all additions, however, as 11 games are set to leave the service in the near future. Those games include Resident Evil 2 Remake, Just Cause 3 and 4, Life is Strange, and more.

You can check out the full list of games coming to the service below.

PlayStation Plus Game Catalog Games January 2025

PlayStation Plus Extra and Premium | Game Catalog

  • God of War Ragnarök | PS4, PS5
  • Like a Dragon Gaiden: The Man Who Erased His Name | PS4, PS5
  • Atlas Fallen: Reign of Sand | PS5
  • SD Gundam Battle Alliance | PS4, PS5
  • Sayonara Wild Hearts | PS4
  • ANNO: Mutationem | PS4, PS5
  • Orcs Must Die 2 | PS4, PS5
  • Citizen Sleeper | PS4, PS5
  • Poker Club | PS4

PlayStation Plus Premium | PS VR2 & Classics

  • Indiana Jones and the Staff of Kings | PS4, PS5
  • Medievil 2 | PS4, PS5

What do you think of the games coming to the PlayStation Plus Game Catalog in January 2025? Let us know down below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming Forums.

For more Insider Gaming, check out the plans for future hero additions to the Marvel Rivals roster moving forward. And don’t forget to sign up for our newsletter.
